title: Being a young researcher in Slovenia

author: Maarten de Groot, National Institute of Biology

segmentation: My name is Martin Holt and doctor.
The Marcia asked me to give a presentation not only about my results of my work, but how did I like my my.
Over here in Slovenia.
Did I?
I will tell you now.
But I would first want you to tell you a little bit more about my background.
I was doing my bio biologists study in Wageningen University and my main focus was on.
Ecology and entomology.
So after my study I started to look for a PhD study to continue my career in science and I ended up here in Slovenia, WHI actually, Slovenia of all places now.
Actually it's very easy.
Love brought me here.
So it was already before I finished my study and I did my MSE thesis about the effect of invasive plant species on insect diversity.
And after that I was actually looking in all kinds of places here in Slovenia.
If I could be do a PhD study.
And Luckily I found here in my place.
So what is actually the difference between doing a PhD in the Netherlands?
Or in Slovenia, first, I think it's.
Important to note that.
Before I started here, the periods you had.
For your PhD study was a four and a half years.
Nowadays I heard it was three and half years in the Netherlands is mainly for years.
The work done here can be discriptive, or you can do experiments while in the Netherlands you're doing mainly experiments.
The thesis consists in Slovenia out of a book or since a few years.
Can do.
Articles well in the Netherlands it only consists out of articles, so if you can see here on the left side an example of Slovene thesis an on the right side of a Dutch thesis.
Adam.
Language and then Slovenia is mainly Slovene and some are doing it in English well in in the Netherlands.
The main part is doing it in English, while some are doing it in Dutch.
So you come over here as a foreign person and the first barrier you have to take is your beautiful language.
First you start with.
6 cases singular, dual and plural.
So when I came here.
It's mainly talked English.
So it happened once, let's say in the field that I was walking around and Slovenian woman came to me and started to speak Slovene.
I rehearse very nicely or post it and never assume slovensko.
It's I'm afraid that I told it so nicely that she spoke even faster Slovenia.
But after now taking many courses.
I can understand a large part of the Slovene language and can also talk some with colleagues of mine.
As you can see over here.
So this is a gradual process which happened during my PhD study, but this was not the actual purpose I was here.
I wanted to do a PhD.
And I went on and.
Dig myself into the world of vibrational communication.
The team I was working on was recognition search initiation search behavior.
In Hemiptera, insects mediated by vibrational communication.
The only group here in Slovenia working on this topic is the Department of Entomology.
And.
I was lucky and met there a lot of nice colleagues and a good atmosphere to do my experiments.
The.
As you can see on the left side on the right side, my model species were on the left side, the stinkbug and on the right side you see them leafhopper.
I went a lot into the field to collect the animals beating bushes so they were dropping into my umbrellas.
And did a lot of experiments insight.
As you can see, this was my setup on the top I put my Mail and presented it on with female calls on there.
As you can see on the mini shakers on the right and on the left.
And.
With female calls which differed in amplitude temporal parameters, an degrees of deley.
Of course, as you all know or you will know, it took a lot of time and it's.
Weeks and weekends, which were suspended in the lap.
So of course results came out.
First of all, Mills.
Mills using vibration of communications are more responsive with when there are more females around.
Louder females are better recognized in noisy environments.
Alternating females compromise compromise this special species specific signals in vibrational communication.
And searching behavior depends on the mating strategies.
OK, this sounds all logic to you.
But if vibrational communications device never tested yet, so this this research first time showed this result.
So.
Published it in quite high.
Journals.
Like here in the Journal of Experimental Biology an I got profit professional acceptance for the Journal Behavioral Ecology.
And.
So you can say I was very happy with the result.
But of course PhD is not only experiments.
First of all, Nip organizes a lot of social activities that you will know.
What is happening within the Institute like here.
Martino, vanya.
You went to a nice.
Nice vinski class.
And so you can talk in peace with other people.
What other?
There are also other activities like Congresses where you can.
You can.
Show what are your results.
You can make Contacts an brought in your field of interests.
You could you can also do other activities during your.
Your PhD study.
So I was helping twice with the Slovene Anthropological Logical Symposium.
And help with other projects so you get also insight in what people within the within are actually doing.
Here I was helping with monitoring of animals and my part was doing the monitoring of hoverflies.
So.
If.
With the experience of now, go back in the past.
Would I do it again?
Yes.
I think here Atnip where we're doing good research.
There are nice colleagues I was working with.
Is a good environment to do experiments?
Ann, you also had opportunities to do other experiments, so without awards I'm grateful I could do my research over here.
I want to thank you for your attention.
And if you have any questions please.
